title: Six persons A, B, C, D, E & F are standing in a circle. B is between D & C. A is between E & C. F is at the right of D. Who is between A & F? - Quora

response.answer_text: E is between A and F. When placing B between D and C, TWO possibilities are there. B being in middle of D and C in CLOCKWISE direction, or ANTICLOCKWISE direction. Once you select an option, say anticlockwise, then place E and A in anticlockwise position ( only option left, with first assumption), then last placing of F comes on LEFT of D. (here ‘left’ meaning in anticlockwise next to D), which is against given data. Hence you rearrange D, B, C in clockwise direction, fill in the remaining letters and you get E in middle of A and F.

Six persons A, B, C, D, E & F are standing in a circle. B is between D & C. A is between E & C. F is at the right of D. Who is between A & F? F is at the right of D. D is at the left of F D ——F C —B ——D —F ( B is between D & C) E—-A——C—— B ———D —-F ( A is between E & C) F ——E—-A——C—— B ———D —-F E is between F and A
